title: Cyclotruncated simplectic honeycomb
summary: In geometry, the cyclotruncated simplectic honeycomb (or cyclotruncated n-simplex honeycomb) is a dimensional infinite series of honeycombs, based on the symmetry of the A ~ n {\displaystyle {\tilde {A}}_{n}} affine Coxeter group. It is given a Schl√§fli symbol t0,1{3[n+1]}, and is represented by a Coxeter-Dynkin diagram as a cyclic graph of n+1 nodes with two adjacent nodes ringed. It is composed of n-simplex facets, along with all truncated n-simplices.
